LongDescription: What the Protectorate lacks in advanced missile technology, it makes up for in volume.  These rocket launchers are just a series of tubes banded together with an ignition circuit run through them but up close, where they can't miss, their damage rivals that of even a particle beam.
FlavorText:
TO: LOGICOM, OTDEL
FROM: CKEYS

Okay, this should do the trick. I had Alexander change out the ignition triggers for electrical heat-sensitive triggers, these should operate better in cold black than the atmospheric factory standard. I don't know what kind of munition you're going to put in here but I'd stick with the basic rockets if you ask me. These launchers are as basic as they come unless you want to pour in the silver to fund development of your own VLS, which I'm sure the Otdel is not too eager to start.

Honestly, it's not entirely a bad thing. Unlike our olive drab-wearing friends over in Shelter, you don't have to wait a thousand years just to program a rocket. Point and shoot with the RL18.
